maml:description.maml:para: Creates an eventhub consumer group.
Creates a consumer group in the Eventhub associated with the specified IotHub.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a consumer group to the telemetry eventhub

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new consumergroup named "myconsumergroup" to the eventhub for telemetry events in the iothub named "myiothub"

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Add a consumer group to the operations monitoring eventhub

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new consumergroup named "myconsumergroup" to the eventhub for operations monitoring events in the iothub named "myiothub"

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an IotHub Key.
Creates a Key for the provided IotHub. KeyNames are not unique and need to be managed carefully.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSAccessRights

System.Collections.Generic.List`1[[Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSSharedAccessSignatureAuthorizationRule, Microsoft.Azure.Commands.IotHub, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 Add a Key to an IotHub

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a key named "mykey" for the iothub "myiothub" with RegistryRead permissions.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about the IotHubs in a subscription.
Gets information about the IotHubs in a subscription. You can view all IotHub instances in a subscription, or filter your results by a resource group or a particular IotHub Name.
System.Collections.Generic.List`1[[Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSIotHub, Microsoft.Azure.Commands.IotHub, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all the IotHubs in the subscription.
Gets all the IotHubs in the subscription belonging to the resourcegroup named "myresourcegroup".
Gets information about the IotHub named "myiothub".

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the IotHub connectionstrings.
Gets the IotHub connectionstrings. You can either get connectionstrings for all the keys or filter them by a specific key name.

System.Collections.Generic.List`1[[Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSSharedAccessSignatureAuthorizationRule, Microsoft.Azure.Commands.IotHub, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the connectionstrings for all keys for the iothub named "myiothub"

command:example.maml:title: Example 2 Get the IotHub connectionstrings for a specific key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the connectionstrings for the key named "mykey" for the iothub named "myiothub"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets all the eventhub consumergroups.
Gets all the eventhub consumergroups for the different EventHubs used by IotHub.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 Gets all the eventhub consumergroups for the telemetry eventhub

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all the eventhub consumergroups for the telemetry eventhub for the iothub named myiothub

command:example.maml:title: Example 2 Gets all the eventhub consumergroups for the operationsmonitoring eventhub

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all the eventhub consumergroups for the operationsMonitoringEvents eventhub for the iothub named myiothub

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the information about an IotHub job.

Gets the information about an IotHub Job. An IotHub Job gets created when an import or export operation is initialted using the New-AzureRmIotHubExportDevices or New-AzureRmIotHubImportDevices commands. You can either list all the jobs or filter the jobs by the Job Identifier.
System.Collections.Generic.List`1[[Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSIotHubJobResponse, Microsoft.Azure.Commands.IotHub, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all the jobs for the IotHub named "myiothub"
Gets information about the job with the identifier "3630fc31-4caa-43e8-a232-ea0577221cb2" for the IotHub named "myiothub"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an IotHub Key.
Gets an IotHub Key. You can either list all Keys or filter the list by a specific Key Name.

System.Collections.Generic.List`1[[Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSSharedAccessSignatureAuthorizationRule, Microsoft.Azure.Commands.IotHub, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all the Keys for the IotHub named "myiothub"

command:example.maml:title: Example 2 Get information for a specific Key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the information for a key named "iothubowner" for the IotHub named "myiothub"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Quota Metrics for an IotHub.
Gets the Quota Metrics for an IotHub.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Quota Metric information for the IotHub named "myiothub"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the RegistryStatistics for an IotHub.
Gets the RegistryStatistics for an IotHub. This provides information about the number of total, enabled and disabled devices in an IotHub.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the RegistryStatictics for the IotHub named "myiothub"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets all valid skus that this IotHub can transition to.

Gets all the valid skus that this IotHub can transition to. An IotHub cannot transition between free and the paid skus and vice versa. You will have to delete and recreate the iothub if you want to achieve this.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of all skus for the IotHub named "myiothub"

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new IotHub.
Creates a new IotHub. You can create the IotHub with either the default properties or specify the input proerties.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSIotHubSku System.Int64 Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSIotHubInputProperties

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 Create a new IotHub with default properties

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new IotHub named "myiothub" of the sku "S1", capacity 1 and location "northeurope".

command:example.maml:title: Example 2 Create a new IotHub with the MaxDeliveryCount of the CloudtoDevice Queue set to 20

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new IotHub named "myiothub" of the sku "S1", capacity 1 and location "northeurope" with advanced input properties represented by $properties.

$psCloudToDeviceProperties = New-Object Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSCloudToDeviceProperties -Property @{MaxDeliveryCount=20} $properties = New-Object Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.IotHub.Models.PSIotHubInputProperties -Property @{CloudToDevice=$psCloudToDeviceProperties} New-AzureRmIotHub -ResourceGroupName "myresourcegroup" -Name "myiothub" -SkuName "S1" -Units 1 -Location "northeurope" -Properties $properties

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new export devices job.

Creates a new export devices job for the IotHub. This will export all the devices to the specified container. Refer to the following article on how to generate the SAS URI. https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/iot-hub-bulk-identity-mgmt/ .

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 Issue an export device request.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new export device request for the IotHub "myiothub" excluding the keys.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new import devices job.

Creates a new import devices job for the IotHub. This will import all the devices to the IotHub from the specified container. Refer to the following article on how to generate the SAS URI. https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/iot-hub-bulk-identity-mgmt/ .

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new import device request for the IotHub "myiothub".
